title: The Galaxy Activity, Torus, and Outflow Survey (GATOS): TBD. Unveiling physical processes in local active galaxies. Unsupervised hierarchical clustering of JWST MIRI/MRS observations
summary: This paper introduces a method to automatically separate different physical regions within the central parts of galaxies using integral field spectroscopy data from the GATOS survey. The analysis of spatially resolved data aims to understand physical processes and characterize main ionization sources in local active galaxies through unsupervised hierarchical clustering of JWST MIRI/MRS observations.
usefulness_reason: Score 75 assigned because the paper is based on a "Survey" (GATOS) and deals with "spatially resolved data" in galaxies, which directly relates to "Spatio Temporal" and "Survey data". The goal of "automatically separate different physical regions" and understanding "physical processes" suggests an analysis of patterns in spatial data, which can be conceptually linked to point processes, even if the term is not explicitly used.
